title: EEG Study 0: Event-Related Potentials in Depression
abstract: Background: EEG analysis is crucial for understanding brain function. Methods: We recorded from 10 participants during rest and task conditions. Results: Significant differences in alpha asymmetry were observed. Conclusion: EEG markers show promise for diagnosis and monitoring.

title: EEG Study 1: Delta Waves in Deep Sleep
abstract: This study investigates EEG patterns in 1 subjects with a focus on neural oscillations. We found significant correlations between theta power and cognitive performance. Results suggest potential biomarkers for clinical applications.

title: EEG Study 2: Seizure Prediction Using Machine Learning
abstract: This study investigates EEG patterns in 2 subjects with a focus on neural oscillations. We found significant correlations between theta power and cognitive performance. Results suggest potential biomarkers for clinical applications.
